statement.p: Consider a Toyota Prius weighing 3551 lbs.
How much does the kinetic energy increase from 16 to 26 mph?
How much does the kinetic energy increase from 26 to 36 mph?

In these units kinetic energy is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left(\frac{{m}}{{g}}\right)}{v}^{{2}}. g is the gravitational constant: \displaystyle{g}=\frac{{{32}\text{ft}}}{\text{sec}}. The energy will be in foot pounds which results from mass in pound mass and velocity in feet per second. Round using the rules of measurements.
